page.title: 04"ABBOTSBROOK",BOURNE END
page.content: This estate is private and has always been so.The name Abbotsbrook comes from the stream which runs through the residents' gardens and from the Abbey (now three houses),which was founded in 1230 as a home and school for nuns. It is supposed to be haunted.The stream is 3/4 of a mile long and flows round the estate,then into the river Thames. The estate was developed in 1895,when it was called the Abbey estate,and is important,because of its unique Edwardian development.The average age of an Abbotsbrook house is 50 years old,for now,new houses are filling in for old houses,and younger people have begun to move into the area.Most people like living on the Abbotsbrook because of its privacy and river landscape.A group of senior residents called the Trustees pay for estate repairs from out of the Resident's Fund.
